text.section: In addition to any other powers granted or duties imposed by this subtitle, each board of library trustees has the powers and duties set forth in this section.

section.section:
Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, each board of library trustees:
Shall establish and operate the library to provide free services to residents of the county in which it is located; and
May permit persons outside of the county to use the library facilities on the terms and conditions it determines.

In Baltimore City and Baltimore, Charles, Montgomery, and Prince George's counties, the board of library trustees in each of these counties may permit a library to charge fees for the rental of video cassettes.

text.section:
Each board of library trustees may:
Establish and operate libraries at any location in the county;
Determine the policy of the library; and
Adopt reasonable rules, regulations, and bylaws for the use of the library and the conduct of its business.

Each board of library trustees may:
Advise in the preparation of, and approve, the library budget;
Receive, account for, control, and supervise, under the rules and regulations of the county governing body, the spending of all public funds received by the library; and
Use the services of the fiscal agencies of the county governing body.
